author: Special Correspondent
text:
The move is part of the department’s initiative to celebrate International Women’s Day —Photo: K. Pichumani

Women customers who walked into some of the city post offices were in for a surprise as there was a dedicated counter for them.

The Department of Posts launched exclusive counters to help women open saving accounts in a number of post offices in the city.

The new initiative, which is part of the department’s gesture to commemorate International Women’s Day on March 8, was launched on March 1. The counters will function till March 11{+t}{+h}{+.}

These counters will function with the help of women employees.

This is to encourage more women to open savings accounts, including recurring deposits, term deposits, Selvamagal Semipu and Ponmagan Podhuvaippu Nidhi. Magalir mattum counters were manned by women employees in all nine head post offices, such as T.Nagar and Park Town, and some sub-post offices, including Anna nagar.

Some post offices offered prizes for women customers who opened savings account. In Anna Nagar post office alone, about 80 savings accounts were opened in a single day.

This facility is aimed at helping women open saving accounts in post offices
title: Ahead of Women’s Day, post offices set up special counters
